channel.title: Elasticsearch Quickstart on Run production-grade databases easily on Kubernetes
channel.description: Recent content in Elasticsearch Quickstart on Run production-grade databases easily on Kubernetes

item.title: Elasticsearch Quickstart
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. Elasticsearch QuickStart This tutorial will show you how to use KubeDB to run an Elasticsearch database. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster. If you do not already have a cluster, you can create one by using Minikube. Now, install KubeDB cli on your workstation and KubeDB operator in your cluster following the steps here.
